channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for OR
channel.description: The latest Form 5800.1 hazardous material reports submitted to the Department of Transportation and posted online by the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration, for OR

item.title: Report X-2024051024
item.description:
Report X-2024051024

Identified by scraper @ 2024-06-05T15:12:36+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-05-10
  • City: PORTLAND
  • State: OR
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: RESPONDER WAS CALLED TO A LEAKER IN UNLOAD DOOR. WHILE WALKING UP, RESPONDER COULD SEE THAT THERE WAS A WET PACKAGE NEAR THE DOOR OF THE TRAILER ON THE LEFT SIDE OF THE UNLOAD DEVICE. RESPONDER COULD SEE THE CORROSIVE DIAMOND HAZARD LABEL (UN2794). RESPONDER WORE APPROPRIATE PPE AND MOVED THE PACKAGE INTO A LINED SPILL TRAY. CLEANED UP THE WET SPOT IN THE TRAILER ACCORDING TO THE CORRISIVE RESPONCE SHEET, THEN BROUGHT ALL AFFECTED PACKAGES AND DEBRIS BACK TO PSC FOR FURTHER PROCESSING

item.title: Report X-2024051447
item.description:
Report X-2024051447

Identified by scraper @ 2024-06-05T15:12:36+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-05-10
  • City: PORTLAND
  • State: OR
  • Report Type: Undeclared Shipment with no Release
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: EMPLOYEE FOUND PACKAGE THAT APPEARED TO BE LEAKING AND FOLLOWED PROCEDURES. RESPONDER CAME AND USED THE DECISION TREE TO PROPERLY RESPOND TO THE PACKAGE AND BRING IT BACK TO THE PSC FOR FURTHER PROCESSING. UPON INSPECTING, THE PACKAGE WAS AFFECTED BY AN UNKNOWN OUTSIDE SOURCE BUT THE INNER CONTENTS APPEARED TO BE AN UNDECLARED HAZMAT. HMSC WAS CALLED AND INSTRUCTED THE PACKAGE BE PUT ON HOLD FOR REGULATORY COMPLIANCE. REWRAP; PACAKGE WAS LEAKED ON BY ANOTHER PACKAGE IN THE SORT; NO DAMAGE TO BATTERY

item.title: Report X-2024051769
item.description:
Report X-2024051769

Identified by scraper @ 2024-06-03T15:13:02+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-05-25
  • City: EUGENE
  • State: OR
  • Report Type: Undeclared Shipment with no Release
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: RESPONDER LOCATED PKG ON THE DMP TABLE IN A TUB. WHEN RESPONDER OPENED THE PKG, NOTICED THE AEROSOL CAN IMMEDIATELY AFTER LIFTING THE INTERNAL PACKAGING. AS SOON AS RESPONDER SAW THE AEROSOL CAN, STOPPED AND CLOSED UP THE BOX TO DOUBLE CHECK FOR ANY HAZMAT MARKINGS. CALLED THE HAZMAT HELP DESK FOR FURTHER INSTRUCTIONS. DAMAGE INSPECTION; NON HAZ LEAKER; NO LEAK TO AEROSOL CAN

  • Description: PACKAGE CAME TO QA LEAKING. UPON CLOSER INSPECTION FOUND THAT THE PLASTIC BOTTLE HAD LOOSE CAPS AND WAS LOADED AT PREVEOUS LOCATION ON ITS SIDE. NO INNER PACKING. ALL EXCESS LIQUID ABSORBED BY THE BOX.

item.title: Report X-2024051705
item.description:
Report X-2024051705

Identified by scraper @ 2024-05-30T18:16:39+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-05-24
  • City: PORTLAND
  • State: OR
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: RESPONDER RESPONDED TO THE LEAKING CLASS 3 HAZMAT ON THE WEST IRREGS BELT. THE PACKAGE WAS WET BUT NO LIQUID WAS ACTIVELY LEAKING FROM THE PACKAGE. THE PACKAGE APPEARED TO HAVE BEEN CRUSHED AND WAS AT SOME POINT RETAPED BEFORE MAKING IT TO THE IRREGS BELT. THE PACKAGE WAS RETURNED TO THE PSC FOR PROCESSING. ONE BOTTLE WAS PROCESSED THROUGH THE DMP, AND THREE UNAFFECTED BOTTLES WILL BE RETURNED TO THE SENDER VIA SALVAGE DRUM.

item.title: Report E-2024050626
item.description:
Report E-2024050626

Identified by scraper @ 2024-05-30T18:16:39+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-05-09
  • City: CLACKAMAS
  • State: OR
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO CNW, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: It was reported that 1-ounce of Unisol Liquid Red BK-50 was released from a 275-gallon Tote, impacting only the top face of the tote. The Tote had a loose lid on the top, causing the release. ERTS reviewed the SDS and PPE requirements for the product with the caller and determined the terminal would clean the spill, containing the waste in one 30-gallon metal drum.
